snippet: A Doctors Without Borders spokeswoman said about 1,000 refugees on the island of Kos had been locked inside the stadium for 24 hours and had no food and very little water.
abstract: Greek officials estimate that there are more than 6,000 refugees on island of Kos in southeastern Aegean Sea, most from Iraq and Syria, who are waiting for papers to allow them to legally enter Greece; illustrating level of chaos, Doctors Without Borders reports that government has locked about 1,000 refugees, including women, children and elderly, inside a stadium overnight with little water and no food.
lead_paragraph: A Doctors Without Borders spokeswoman said about 1,000 refugees on the island of Kos had been locked inside the stadium for 24 hours and had no food and very little water.

headline.main: Greece Rounds Up Migrants on Kos, Locking Them in Stadium Overnight
headline.print_headline: Greece Gathers Hundreds of Migrants, Locking Them in Stadium Overnight

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
